  • All Classes

Package plugins

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Aspect
    This tool calculates slope aspect (i.e., slope orientation in degrees) for each grid cell in an input digital elevation model (DEM).
    AverageSlopeToDivide
    This tool calculates the average slope gradient (i.e., slope steepness in degrees) of the flowpaths that run through each grid cell in an input digital elevation model (DEM) to the upslope divide cells.
    AverageUpslopeFlowpathLength
    This tool calculates the average length of the flowpaths that run through each grid cell (in map horizontal units) in a flow pointer grid.
    BranchLength
    Maximum branch length (Bmax) is the longest branch length between a grid cell's flowpath and the flowpaths initiated at each of its neighbours.
    Contour
    Creates a vector contour coverage from a digital elevation model (DEM).
    DeviationFromMeanElevation
    This tool can be used to calculate the difference between the elevation of each grid cell and the mean elevation of the centering local neighbourhood, normalized by standard deviation.
    DifferenceFromMeanElevation
    This tool can be used to calculate the difference in between the elevation of each grid cell in an input DEM and the average elevation in the local neighbourhood.
    DirectionalRelief
    This tool calculates the relief for each grid cell in a digital elevation model (DEM) in a specified direction.
    DownslopeIndex
    This tool can be used to calculate the downslope index described by Hjerdt et al (2004).
    ElevAbovePit
    This tool will calculate the elevation of each grid cell in a digital elevation model (DEM) above the nearest downslope pit cell or grid edge cell, depending on which is encountered first during the flow-path traverse.
    ElevRelativeToMinMax
    This tool can be used to express the elevation of a grid cell in a digital elevation model (DEM) as a percentage of the relief between the DEM minimum and maximum values.
    ElevRelativeToWatershedMinMax
    This tool can be used to express the elevation of a grid cell in a digital elevation model (DEM) as a percentage of the relief between the watershed minimum and maximum values.
    ExposureTowardsWindFlux
    This tool creates a new raster in which each grid cell is assigned the exposure of the land-surface to a hypothetical wind flux.
    FetchAnalysis
    This tool creates a new raster in which each grid cell is assigned the distance, in meters, to the nearest topographic obstacle in a specified direction.
    FindRidges
    This tool can be used to identify ridge cells in a digital elevation model (DEM).
    Hillshade
    This tool performs a hillshade operation on an input digital elevation model (DEM).
    HorizonAngle
    This tool calculates the horizon angle (Sx) i.e., the maximum slope along a specified azimuth (0-360 degrees) for each grid cell in an input digital elevation model (DEM).
    MaxDownslopeElevationChange
    This tool calculates the maximum elevation drop between each grid cell and its neighbouring cells.
    MaxUpslopeFlowpathLength
    This tool calculates the maximum length of the flowpaths that run through each grid cell (in map horizontal units) in a flow pointer grid.
    MinDownslopeElevationChange
    This tool calculates the minimum elevation drop between each grid cell and its neighbouring cells.
    NumDownslopeNeighbours
    This tool calculates the number of downslope neighbours of each grid cell in a raster digital elevation model (DEM).
    NumUpslopeNeighbours
    This tool calculates the number of upslope neighbours of each grid cell in a raster digital elevation model (DEM).
    Pennocks_Landform_Classification
    Tool can be used to perform a simple landform classification based on measures of slope gradient and curvature derived from a user-specified digital elevation model (DEM).
    PlanCurv
    This tool calculates the plan curvature (i.e., contour curvature), or the rate of change in aspect along a contour line, from a digital elevation model (DEM).
    ProfCurv
    This tool calculates the profile curvature, or the rate of change in slope along a flow line, from a digital elevation model (DEM).
    RelativeAspect
    This tool creates a new raster in which each grid cell is assigned the terrain aspect relative to a user-specified wind direction.
    RelativeStreamPowerIndex
    This tool can be used to calculate the relative stream power index.
    SedimentTransportIndex
    This tool can be used to calculate the sediment transport index (STI) described by Moore and Burch (1986).
    Slope
    This tool calculates slope gradient (i.e., slope steepness in degrees) for each grid cell in an input digital elevation model (DEM).
    StochasticDepressionAnalysis
    This tool can be used to map topographic depressions in a digital elevation model (DEM), taking into account the uncertainty in depression shape resulting from DEM error.
    TangentialCurv
    This tool calculates the tangential curvature.
    TopographicRuggednessIndex
    The topographic ruggedness index (TRI) is a measure of local topographic relief.
    TotalCurv
    This tool calculates the total curvature, which is the curvature of the surface itself and not the curvature of intersecting lines (e.g., profile and plan curvatures).
    Viewshed
    This tool can be used to calculate the viewshed (the visible area) from a location (viewing station) or group of locations based on the topography defined by an input digital elevation model (DEM).
    VisibilityIndex
    This tool can be used to calculate the visibility of all locations within an input digital elevation model (DEM).
    WetnessIndex
    This tool can be used to calculate the topographic wetness index, commonly used in the TOPMODEL rainfall-runoff framework.
